description: When the user seeks tranquility, satisfaction with what Allah has given, and inner peace amidst external noise.

primary.text_en: Verily, in the remembrance of Allah do hearts find rest.
primary.explanation: True peace and contentment come from remembering Allah.

primary.text_en: So when you have finished [your duties], then stand up [for worship]. And to your Lord direct [your] longing.
primary.text_ar: فَإِذَا فَرَغْتَ فَٱنصَبْ وَإِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَٱرْغَب
primary.explanation: Fulfillment lies in turning consistently to Allah.

primary.text_en: Say, 'Nothing will ever befall us except what Allah has destined for us. He is our Protector.'
primary.text_ar: قُل لَّن يُصِيبَنَآ إِلَّا مَا كَتَبَ ٱللَّهُ لَنَا هُوَ مَوْلَىٰنَا
primary.explanation: Trusting Allah’s decree is the key to contentment.

primary.text_en: Richness is not having many possessions, but true richness is being content with oneself.
Look at those below you and do not look at those above you. That is better so that you do not belittle Allah's favors upon you.
Whoever among you wakes up secure in his home, healthy in his body, and has his food for the day, it is as if the world has been gathered for him.

duas.text_en: O Allah, make me content with what You have provided me, bless it for me, and replace for me every absent thing with something better.
duas.text_ar: اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْنِي رَاضِيًا بِمَا قَسَمْتَ لِي، وَبَارِكْ لِي فِيهِ، وَاخْلُفْ عَلَيَّ كُلَّ غَائِبٍ بِخَيْرٍ
duas.explanation: A heartfelt plea for lasting satisfaction.

duas.text_en: O Allah, suffice me with what You have allowed instead of what You have forbidden, and enrich me with Your grace from all others besides You.
duas.text_ar: اللَّهُمَّ اكْفِنِي بِحَلالِكَ عَنْ حَرَامِكَ، وَأَغْنِنِي بِفَضْلِكَ عَمَّنْ سِوَاكَ
duas.explanation: Seeking spiritual independence through divine sufficiency.

reflection: Contentment is not passive — it is a calm strength. The believer who trusts Allah’s plan, is thankful in all situations, and seeks no more than what brings them closer to their Lord, experiences an unshakable peace. Let the heart rest where it was made to belong — near Allah.
